BURR, Primary Examiner US. Cl. X.R. 197--55 11. The mechanism of claim 6, said shoulder being a flat projecting member having a first and second surface and being positioned in a plane perpendicular to said shaft, said arm having a first and second spring finger projecting therefrom, said shoulder being engaged between said spring fingers so that said first surface is engaged by the first spring finger and said second surface is engaged by said second spring finger, whereby said shoulder and said shaft are adapted to tiltably move in an arc, to slideably move vertically and to move rotationally while being engaged by said fingers. a shoulder is provided on said shaft, which shoulder is engaged by said arm to interconnect the arm and the print head. 10. The mechanism of claim 9 wherein: wherein said first and second set of indicia comprises parallel bands of print symbols. 9. The mechanism of claim 8 wherein said print head comprises a circular disc, and 8. The mechanism of claim 7 wherein said electromagnetic means comprise solenoids.
